column3: English Translation
**Me:** (Testing audio levels - cement abcd leave okay?) Hmm okay.
**Me:** (Background noise - hit that turn off)
**Me:** Have you used Momo (Note: JSON misheard as ""mom"") recently?
**Interviewee:** Hmm, I haven't used Momo, I have used Shopee.
**Me:** OK. What kind of things do you usually buy (Note: JSON misheard as ""sell"") online?

**Interviewee:** Hmm... let me think... what do I buy online... I buy some rather strange things. For example, because I like to make, hmm, like charms and that kind of handmade craft, so I buy those kinds of materials, or yarn, things like that, I also knit, things like that, I buy all these things online.
**Me:** Okay. Do you think there's anything you want to buy on Momo?
**Interviewee:** I want to buy, I want to buy health supplements. I feel like recently... I feel like my memory has been declining recently, so I want to buy vitamins to take.

column3: **Me:** Hmm. (Waiting for page to load) No vitamins, huh?

**Me:** So you want to buy this vitamin? Hmm. Does this webpage seem to have no pictures? No pictures of it? (Sees picture) There is... Is it still searching (Note: TXT misheard as ""setting card"")? Is it not ready yet? You can try refreshing once. Ah, do you think it's a network problem? Sometimes the school network is like this, a bit strange. So, or do you want to connect to mine?
**Interviewee:** Oh okay.
**Me:** Hand over the password.
**Interviewee:** (Connects to hotspot) Really, it's a network problem. Yes, there are many pictures.
**Me:** Okay. Have you bought this recently?
**Interviewee:** Hmm... Yes.
**Me:** So cool.

**Interviewee:** I haven't taken it myself, but someone in my family has taken it before. But I'm not very familiar with that family member, so I've only heard that they bought fish oil, I haven't seen them take it.
**Me:** Hmm. So what happened just now? Was there anything new? Wow, this popped up directly, so cool.
**Me:** What do you think is its most obvious part?

**Interviewee:** What I see now is that it has listed the carbon footprint, meaning whether this company has that... whether it has the concept of environmental protection... it listed it very detailedly.
**Me:** Hmm. Do you consider yourself an environmentally conscious person?
**Interviewee:** Hmm... Do you consider yourself an environmentally conscious person? Or just okay?

**Interviewee:** Hmm, environmental protection... care about them (Note: TXT misheard as ""method""), right? It's okay. It's just that I pay attention to this, because when I was young, people often said that, if there's an item, it's best to buy it in your own, like your own home area, that way the carbon footprint won't be as high. So, if understood, it's okay, but sometimes I do pay attention.
**Me:** What do you think is the useful part of this data (Note: TXT misheard as ""fine treatment"")?

**Interviewee:** Useful part... useful part... I feel it can let users see, like, oh, this company you're considering buying from, its, whether it's putting effort into environmental protection, like that. Wow, there's really a lot here. Let me look at other options.
**Interviewee:** (Looking at MUJI bag) MUJI? What kind of product is this?
**Me:** It's a shopping bag.

**Interviewee:** It's that... at school, at school I see quite a lot of people carrying this MUJI shopping bag (Note: TXT misheard as ""and my feeling""), and seeing this, probably just... basically, everyone does, when walking on the street, if we meet ten people, probably half of them will carry one away.
**Me:** You just saw another product, a MUJI product, and then you put this product... can the other product be compared? A report? That AI report from just now.

**Interviewee:** So I should be able to open it first. ""Social responsibility unclear,"" two stores? Both are ""Social responsibility unclear""? Uh-huh. Yeah, I've heard of them all... (muttering)... already.

**Me:** (Looking at 3M hook) It rained today, it's really heavy. Otherwise, shall we go for a walk? Oh... hmm... I don't know... seems like there is? Seems like there is? That guy seems to have one? I've decided I'll just connect to my own. I definitely don't want to connect to...
**Interviewee:** It says this is a car? How many? One?
**Me:** I definitely don't want to connect my own. Delivery (Note: TXT misheard as ""black needle"") is on the way.
**Interviewee:** So you're eating too?
**Me:** Yeah. Then why am I still here?
**Interviewee:** You might... What is this? Above? This is a hook (Note: TXT misheard as ""hanging fight""), 3M? Then, wow, this company is good?
**Me:** Did you notice there's a number above that AI?
**Interviewee:** This one? Hmm.
**Me:** Can you help me write this... here, okay? Like before, any one is fine.
**Interviewee:** All three?
**Me:** All three? You just introduced three different products.
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Me:** Then can you help me take a photo, of these three?
**Interviewee:** All are okay? Go take a photo of what it says?

**Me:** The top one is mine. Okay. Then circle one, choose one, which one above is more useful to choose? This one? Okay. Then below there are, there are two buttons (Note: TXT misheard as ""cases""), which one do you want to press, or no need to press that one?
**Interviewee:** No need to press.
**Me:** Okay.
**Me:** Where do you think the AI went just now? What is this thing?
**Interviewee:** This is the place of origin. Hmm. Then, wait, then here is that...
**Me:** Hmm, AI?
**Interviewee:** ...alternative products.
**Me:** Hmm. Do you think you have any questions you want to ask the AI (Note: JSON misheard as ""wei wei wei"" - feeding sounds)?
**Interviewee:** Excuse me... I can't really think of any.
**Me:** It's okay if you don't have any.
**Interviewee:** Hmm, then no.

**Me:** Okay. That's fine then. Phone, you can use your phone to scan this QR. Then below there's a questionnaire (Note: TXT misheard as ""hot spring""). And this test code is just these, so if you tested one product, that's fine. But since you tested three products, you can write three.
**Interviewee:** Hmm. Oh.

column3: English Translation
**Me:** Okay, let me ask again. This is an app that's part of my thesis. I hope you can help me test it. I will record your voice, but your responses will be anonymous. Is that okay?
**Interviewee:** Yes, yes.
**Me:** Okay, thank you. We can start then. Okay. Uh, have you used Momo before?
**Interviewee:** Yes, but I use Shopee more often.
**Me:** Okay. What do you usually buy?
**Interviewee:** Usually? Clothes and cosmetics, and also anime dolls.
**Me:** Hmm. Can you help me find a product you're interested in?
**Interviewee:** (Searches) ...Interested in... product... facial mask.
**Me:** Facial mask? This one? Okay. Like this. Have you bought this brand before?
**Interviewee:** Oh, yes, I've bought it before.
**Me:** Wow, wow, so cool. Buying things basically, buying things is also an investment... Oh, this can help analyze.
**Interviewee:** Hmm, wow, cool.
**Me:** What do you think in this content is useful for you, or serves a purpose? Useful, meaning interesting information, or materials you think are good?

**Interviewee:** Sustainability and this history issue. Usually when browsing, I only see the brand's country and the materials used. I rarely see this ""Material Sustainability"" and ""History Issues"". So when buying, I would think, just, oh, after buying it, maybe it's just, after using it up, it's just trash. But I didn't think that, like, oh, I didn't think that maybe the facial mask could contain some unknown plant extracts and chemical preservatives. I should say I knew, but I didn't know that it might, hmm, pose potential risks, things like that.

**Me:** So you think this, knowing this just now, will it affect your, your thoughts? Your thoughts? Because you have bought this product before (Note: TXT used ""recently""), and you just found out it might contain some chemicals... Regarding this product's brand, will your thoughts change?

**Interviewee:** Hmm, a little bit, a little bit. Maybe I'll look for something more convenient, like something that doesn't require using a sheet mask, maybe just, hmm, how should I say... like, I've seen ones where you don't need to apply a sheet mask, it's like applying... applying that kind of aloe mask, maybe I'll buy that kind later.
**Me:** Mm-hmm mm-hmm. Okay, there's a section below you can press. What do you think this, this means?
**Interviewee:** Savings (Note: TXT misheard as ""Gold Order"")? Hmm? Suppose if I don't buy this item, can I save some amount of money?
**Me:** Okay. Then you need to first, uh, think.
**Interviewee:** Thinking... What do you want to eat? I have no money to eat. ...You should give me money, okay?

**Interviewee:** Oh... Oh! So savings means the carbon emissions (Note: TXT misheard as ""bullet release amount""), reducing carbon emissions? Not money? Oh? And it says if I don't buy that mask I can... I can save how much money? Oh, so expensive.

column3: English Translation
**Interviewer:** So, uh, basically this is the software for my thesis, it roughly helps you, uh, know how eco-friendly the products you buy are. Then, uh, in that case, can I record your audio?
**Interviewee:** Mhm.
**Interviewer:** Is that okay?
**Interviewee:** Oh, I said yes, yes.
**Interviewer:** Okay, thank you. Hehe. Okay, did you just open Momo? Have you used Momo before?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** What kind of things do you basically buy using Momo?
**Interviewee:** Home appliances, skincare products, I have bought food too.
**Interviewer:** Do you have any particularly favorite brands?
**Interviewee:** Seems like no. Depends on the product, not necessarily.
**Interviewer:** Then on Momo, can you help me find a product you want to buy?

**Interviewee:** (Searches) The internet is a bit slow... I'll just randomly find one... I usually go look at the special offer sections... look from the special offer section. Oh, I understand this, looks pretty good, cups.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What did you find just now?
**Interviewee:** Kitty milk.
**Interviewer:** Um. Was there anything new just now?
**Interviewee:** This frame/box.
**Interviewer:** Mhm. What is this? This is...
**Interviewee:** It's meat.
**Interviewer:** What did the AI assistant tell you just now?

**Interviewee:** AI assistant, this... buying things... it says buying things is also a type of investment, I can help you analyze if the money spent is good or bad... company, then it introduced this company, and mentioned the ESG rating score.
**Interviewer:** Do you think there's anything interesting in this content? Or do you think it's usable?

**Interviewee:** I should say, normally when buying things I don't specifically look at ESG rating scores. But I just feel the words are a bit... this section, the first frame, this section has a few too many words, it makes it a bit hard to grasp the main point quickly, for me.
**Interviewer:** Have you bought this product before? Or this brand?
**Interviewee:** I have eaten at this brand's place, but I haven't bought their products, but I have eaten there.

**Interviewer:** Okay. What about the AI assistant, uh, what does it want to say? It also wants to talk about me making this AI assistant. It also wants to talk about this brand's name, materials, sustainability, manufacturing process, group.
**Interviewee:** Um.
**Interviewer:** Is there anything you didn't know before?

**Interviewee:** I should say, I'm a bit curious about how this sustainability rating and labor rating came about. Uh-huh. Right. And this I know, because I know they haven't gone public yet. They haven't gone public? How come I remember they have? Um, I remember they seem to have a stock code, or am I remembering wrong? Okay okay. Oh, I'm quite curious how they rate the score.
**Interviewer:** Okay. There are also buttons above, do you want to press any? (Eco-friendly & Save Money, etc.)

**Interviewee:** (Clicks 'ç’°ä¿çœéŒ¢') Wang Steak Group. I want to be eco-friendly and save money. Um. From where can I increase my savings? Um. Does clicking this trigger a response? Um, yes yes yes. Or do I need to wait?
**Interviewer:** You need to time it a bit.

**Interviewee:** Oh. Future, especially if you want to apply for graduate school? Why would it say especially if I want to apply for graduate school? Oh, a bit curious. Custom budget, OK. Reduce target? Spendthrift? Okay. I thought it would be related to this product. So it has nothing to do with this brand. Oh.
**Interviewer:** Is there anything else you want to ask it?
**Interviewee:** (Doesn't ask)
**Interviewer:** Otherwise, take a look at the total carbon footprint. Should be able to save some money. Or?
**Interviewee:** (Clicks 'æ›¿ä»£å“')
**Interviewer:** Of course. Did you find anything interesting in its response just now? Anything meaningful?
**Interviewee:** Meaningful? Seems, I think it seems okay. But I learned about some new brands. However, I don't really want plant-based meat analogues, analogues.
**Interviewer:** Okay, so you know some new products.
**Interviewee:** Right.
**Interviewer:** Can you help me go back to the Momo page?
**Interviewee:** (Goes back)
**Interviewer:** Above, at the very top, there are still these sections. (Green & purple tabs)
**Interviewee:** (Clicks green tab)
**Interviewer:** What do you think this is?
**Interviewee:** It's that... it should be talking about carbon footprint or something? But I don't know its... like, what this condition is being compared to. I'm quite puzzled. Right.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then the last section. (Clicks purple tab) Investment. Oh.
**Interviewee:** What is this? It just says this company has its stock code.

**Interviewer:** Okay. OK. Then that's about it. Can you help me take a photo of what you think is most important? Like, what was the main point of the content just now? Can you help me take a picture of that... Wait a minute. You you you help me fill out that, uh, the questionnaire part will need the photo.
**Interviewee:** Oh, then I'll just take a picture, just pick one to take?
**Interviewer:** Right.
**Interviewee:** Then I'll take this one.
**Interviewer:** Okay. There's a number at the top, also one, no, just now, that Momo one, over at Momo. Momo. Right right right. At the very top. Can you get it out like this, this number?
**Interviewee:** 50R6E.

**Interviewer:** Okay. OK. Okay. Then that's fine. Later it should, here. Then, ah, no no. That one just now, right. Then at the very bottom there's a questionnaire where you can write this number, the number from just now. Right. Then help me cut, right. That's all another one. Okay, thank you.

column3: English Translation
**Interviewer:** So basically this is part of my thesis, an eco-friendly software. In a moment you can help me test this, and also, can I record your audio?
**Interviewee:** Uh, yes you can.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Have you used Momo before?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What website do you use to buy things?
**Interviewee:** Ah, have you used Shopee or similar ones?
**Interviewer:** Shopee.
**Interviewee:** Shopee.
**Interviewer:** Okay. So, what kind of things do you usually buy online?
**Interviewee:** Usually when I go online, I don't have a fixed thing I buy, it's more like seeing what's lacking in daily life, then I'll buy it myself.
**Interviewer:** Then do you think Momo... has any products you need? Any brand, anything is fine, help me search.
**Interviewee:** (Searches/Navigates)
**Interviewer:** Ah, can you tell me what you were just searching for?
**Interviewee:** I was looking for resistance bands, for exercise.
**Interviewer:** Did you find anything you want to buy?
**Interviewee:** I don't know. I want to buy this one.
**Interviewer:** What is this?
**Interviewee:** That's a fitness resistance rope.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Have you bought this product before? Or this brand?
**Interviewee:** Uh, no.
**Interviewer:** Haven't bought it. Okay. There was a new thing on the side just now, do you know what this is?
**Interviewee:** Uh, what?
**Interviewer:** Okay. Come on. Uh, did you see anything new? Did you see anything, uh, that you hadn't seen before?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewee:** No? Okay. What about the yellow one at the top just now? The yellow one?
**Interviewee:** This one. Um.
**Interviewer:** Uh, this is...
**Interviewer:** Okay. Do you think it's part of this page or something else? What is it?
**Interviewee:** Uh, it's part of the webpage.
**Interviewer:** Okay, OK. Uh, actually, no. That was my own App just now, you downloaded it. What did it tell you just now? What was its content?
**Interviewee:** (Reads/Describes)
**Interviewer:** Okay. What do you think it meant by what it told you just now?
**Interviewee:** That... helps you analyze whether buying this product is good for you.
**Interviewer:** Right. Like, whether spending this money is worth it for you. What do you think is its key point? Its key point?
**Interviewee:** Um... key point... It said it thinks, it thinks this product lacks environmental certification.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Right. This suggests buying other types. Um. There are two more buttons at the very bottom, do you want to press them? (Find Alternatives & Chat with AI)
**Interviewee:** (Clicks 'Find Alternatives')
**Interviewer:** What did it tell you just now?
**Interviewee:** (Reads/Describes)
**Interviewer:** Does this, does this have any meaning for you?
**Interviewee:** I might consider purchasing [one of these] or something.
**Interviewer:** Do you have any other questions you want to ask it? (Points to 'Chat with AI' button)
**Interviewee:** (Doesn't click/ask)
**Interviewer:** Okay. There are two more sections here. (Green & purple tabs)
**Interviewee:** (Clicks green tab)
**Interviewer:** At the very bottom, not here, here, what do you think this is?
**Interviewee:** Oh, analyzing which type to buy can reduce carbon emissions.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then the last one.
**Interviewee:** (Clicks purple tab)

**Interviewer:** That one can't be found. Okay. Then that's roughly enough. Can you help me take a photo, what do you think is the most important point? Just take a photo, take a photo. Uh, just now, come, I'll tell you this part. First, can you help me take a photo? Or a screenshot is also okay.
**Interviewee:** (Takes photo/screenshot)
**Interviewer:** There was a number on top of it just now, can you say it for me?
**Interviewee:** 67LVE.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you help me write it on this card...

column3: English Translation
**Interviewer:** So, basically this software is part of my thesis, it will help you, uh, know how eco-friendly the things you buy are. And, can I record your audio?
**Interviewee:** Yes, yes.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Have you used Momo before?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** What have you bought on Momo?
**Interviewee:** Hey, I've bought those shoes, and also that diffuser bottle.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Is there anything you want, want to buy now?
**Interviewee:** (Searches on Momo) Um... Maybe just buy shoes.
**Interviewer:** Okay, so just click directly into the product I want like this?
**Interviewee:** (Selects hiking boots)
**Interviewer:** This is that hiking boot.
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** So it's, it's the kind of shoe worn for hiking, and it's waterproof, like that.
**Interviewer:** Have you bought this brand before?
**Interviewee:** Before... I'm currently wearing this brand's, this shoe, like this.
**Interviewer:** Right, right, right, right. So on the whole webpage just now, was there anything new you wanted, that you hadn't seen recently?
**Interviewee:** You mean on this webpage? Ah... seems like no.
**Interviewer:** Ah, which way, is this the new one from just now? Right? Ah, oh, is this the thing we just loaded?
**Interviewer:** Yes. What do you think this is?

**Interviewee:** I think, uh, it will look at it once here, it will grab some information from within this product, and then go check its, this brand and this product, its origin, like that. Then go see if this thing is an eco-friendly product.
**Interviewer:** What is that overlay/curtain?
**Interviewee:** I think the main point of this should be the part below, right? Which is the company's overall rating, ah, whether it's consistently high or not too high.
**Interviewer:** Right, it just looks at whether it's high or not high.
**Interviewee:** Looking at it this way, it seems not too high.
**Interviewer:** Then there are two buttons at the very bottom, want to press them?
**Interviewee:** It's okay. It's just that here it looks to see if there are alternative products.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then there are two sections above (green & purple tabs).
**Interviewee:** (Clicks green tab)
**Interviewer:** What is this one?
**Interviewee:** Oh, here it's telling me which brands might have slightly lower carbon emissions, would be more eco-friendly.
**Interviewer:** Ah. Have you bought these other brands?
**Interviewee:** No, these are all brands I haven't seen before.
**Interviewer:** Right, right. But does this whole series affect your, your thoughts?
**Interviewee:** Um, it's okay. Because for shoes, my main focus is still primarily on comfort when wearing them.
**Interviewer:** So unless these brands might have some of that...

**Interviewee:** Have this, if their explanation includes some possibilities regarding these shoes being comfortable to wear, whether they have the functions I want, then I think I'd be more inclined to buy these things.
**Interviewer:** Ah. What about this section? (Clicks purple tab)
**Interviewee:** What is this? Oh, here it's asking if there's a way to track products I've bought from this company, like that.
**Interviewer:** Ah, then just press here, press one...
**Interviewee:** Okay. Then I'll take a look at the product's origin situation.
**Interviewer:** Okay.
**Interviewer:** Is there anything else here...
**Interviewee:** Want to know? I think I'll press this one: How to reduce impulse buying. (Clicks 'Chat with AI')
**Interviewer:** It's searching... oh.

**Interviewee:** So it's saying you should first set a budget, then make a list, first confirm if you really need these things. Actually, before buying, you should think about it, and you can consider buying second-hand things.
**Interviewer:** Ah, something you didn't think of before might be second-hand shopping?
**Interviewee:** Ah, right.
**Interviewer:** Okay. You can also ask it directly, are there, are there any questions you want to ask? Or no?
**Interviewee:** Let me think... (Types question: Are there companies with eco-friendly and comfortable products?)
**Interviewer:** OK OK.

**Interviewee:** Oh, I feel it gave some good suggestions here, because when buying shoes I pay more attention to comfort when wearing them, and I just asked if there are companies with eco-friendly and comfortable products, and it gave me several brands, very very good. Take a look. Then, maybe, compare, I can consider them.
**Interviewer:** Okay.
**Interviewer:** Oh.
**Interviewer:** Oh, because it's quite good. My resp... um, the response is quite, quite fluent.
**Interviewee:** Yeah.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then that's about it. Can you help me take a photo of what you think is the most interesting part, so the useful part?
**Interviewee:** Oh, I think it's this AI, really, the chatbot. (Takes photo)
**Interviewer:** Okay. That stage. Can you help me go back to the Momo page from before, come here, this one, okay? Can you say it for me?
**Interviewee:** You mean this ESG report number: 3MP1P.
**Interviewer:** Okay.

**Interviewer:** OK. Okay. Then that's fine. Later it should be here, then, ah, no no. That one just now, right. Then at the very bottom there's a questionnaire where you can write this number, the number from just now. Right. Then help me cut, right. That's all another one. Okay, thank you.

column3: English Translation
**Interviewer:** So basically, this is part of my thesis, it's an eco-friendly App. Can I also ask, do you agree to let me record this audio?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** Okay. In that case, I'd like to ask, do you usually use Momo?
**Interviewee:** I usually browse it, but haven't used it [to buy].
**Interviewer:** What types of things have you bought on Momo?
**Interviewee:** Haven't used it [to buy].
**Interviewer:** Is there anything you want to buy right now?
**Interviewee:** The other day I was thinking about buying a sous vide machine.
**Interviewer:** Ah, can you find it on Momo?
**Interviewee:** (Clicks/Navigates)
**Interviewer:** The internet seems a bit slow here... Um, choose one first.
**Interviewee:** (Navigates) Otherwise, I'll just click on shoes.
**Interviewer:** Okay, Adidas. Then this...
**Interviewer:** Okay, what do you think this screen is showing? What do you think this is?
**Interviewee:** Uh... it's based on this product, and then there's its introduction and its rating.
**Interviewer:** What important information do you think is in this content?

**Interviewee:** For me, what's more important would be where it's manufactured, then its process, what the manufacturing is like, and also its materials and its rating. How it's made, that would be a standard for consideration for me.
**Interviewer:** Have you bought this brand before?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** This product?
**Interviewee:** Haven't bought it.

**Interviewee:** So I'm still in the price comparison stage. Personally, I feel that if I were to buy it, maybe there could be a bit more, like regarding the price part, its price could be compared with other brands or other products, or have a rating, or some kind of description.
**Interviewer:** Then there are three buttons at the top. Look at the first one first (yellow).
**Interviewer:** Okay, what do you think is the key point of this content?
**Interviewee:** (Reads/Describes) Um... showing you its more detailed information, so you won't buy a fake.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What about the second one (green)?
**Interviewee:** Eco-friendly.
**Interviewee:** This company... overall rating 45... so is it looking at the eco-friendliness level of this product?
**Interviewer:** Mhm.
**Interviewee:** (Reads) ...reduces carbon emissions by 38%... this is also...
**Interviewee:** Oh, this recommends which brand I could buy.
**Interviewer:** Um. Have you bought the other brands? Or...?
**Interviewee:** This one (Adidas), yes. OK. The others, no.
**Interviewer:** Then why would you still buy (Adidas)?
**Interviewee:** Because I buy second-hand stuff. This thing... their... a lot of their stuff is available second-hand...
**Interviewer:** Okay, what about the third section?
**Interviewee:** (Clicks) This is...?
**Interviewer:** What do you think it is?
**Interviewee:** Recommending which other companies I can invest in.
**Interviewee:** Stocks... oh, it also has this... look at the stocks here.
**Interviewer:** Um. Have you bought stocks recently?
**Interviewee:** Um... no.
**Interviewer:** Okay.
**Interviewer:** Okay, do you see the two buttons below? (Find Alternatives & Chat with AI)
**Interviewee:** (Clicks 'Chat with AI')
**Interviewer:** Um. You can ask it questions. You can ask any question, you can just type.
**Interviewee:** Any question?
**Interviewer:** Any question is fine.
**Interviewee:** (Types question)
**Interviewer:** Okay, for you, its answer, what's its key point?

**Interviewee:** I think maybe... the method suggestions there are good, I think, but it could have more, like parts with examples. Because maybe... looking here just now, it might not quite know where to start. Maybe it could find more examples, that's what I think.
**Interviewer:** Right, okay. Um. There are also some (suggested) questions here, is there anything else you really want to ask? Or is it okay?
**Interviewee:** It's okay.
**Interviewer:** What do you think is the difference between it and ChatGPT?
**Interviewee:** (Thinking)... Maybe in the professional aspects, it will have more explanations? And in daily life... (Thinking)
**Interviewer:** It's more likely that it has more professional considerations, not leaning towards daily life. But it's more concerned with environmental protection, and it's embedded within Momo.
**Interviewee:** Mhm.
**Interviewer:** Um, right.
**Interviewer:** Okay, what you feel is the most important part (for you), can you take a photo for me? Use your phone.
**Interviewee:** Take a photo?
**Interviewer:** Yes, take a photo of this screen. The part you feel is most important.
**Interviewee:** Um... (Takes Photo) The environmental rating.
**Interviewer:** The environmental rating? Okay.
**Interviewer:** Okay. There's a number at the top here, can you say it for me? This green number.
**Interviewee:** 80W9Z.
**Interviewer:** Okay, can you help me write it on this card... yes... okay. Then that's about it, thank you.
**Interviewee:** Thank you.
column4: 134,L2LgAG,kzKBJd,2024-12-25 04:14:46,2ITG0,æˆ‘åŒæ„æˆ‘çš„å›ç­”åšç‚ºç ”ç©¶å’Œè¨­è¨ˆä½¿ç”¨,TRUE,æ°´æ¯,åœ‹ç«‹ä¸­èˆˆå¤§å­¸ National Chung Hsing University (NCHU),,å­¸å£«,å¤–æ–‡ç³»,æˆ‘é‚„åœ¨å°±è®€ï¼,æˆ‘æ˜¯å°ç£äººå•Š ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡¼ï¼,,18.0,å°‹æ‰¾æ›¿ä»£ç”¢å“, æŸ¥çœ‹ç”¢å“çš„ç”¢åœ°ç‹€æ³",æ¨™é¡Œå¾ˆå¸å¼•,äººé¡å’ŒAIï¼šä¸€èµ·åˆ†æçš„çµåˆ,è²·æ±è¥¿,æŠ•è³‡,https://storage.tally.so/private/1000004678.jpg?id=oMAGgx&accessToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6Im9NQUdneCIsImZvcm1JZCI6Im1Ka0F5eiIsImlhdCI6MTc1MjI5MTQzN30.SgFzCcRtYyLPv0fgMzZ-2hLmvY84rQFHevCLLeXvwTY&signature=485d7b0bd80d64cf23ccf92f3beb1882e1b7710fd6d90c9e62dcd5215a749099,3.0,åƒ¹æ ¼ï¼š300 å°å¹£ / å…¬æ–¤ã€‚å¼·è¿«å‹å·¥çš„æ¦‚ç‡ï¼š15%,4.0,åƒ¹æ ¼ï¼š66 å°å¹£ï¼Œä¸€ç›’åé¡†é›è›‹å”®åƒ¹ / ç„¡é¤Šé›è³‡è¨Š,åƒ¹æ ¼ï¼š72 å°å¹£,1.0,1.0,2.0,Apple,4.0,4.0,4.0,1.0,æ²’æœ‰,,4.0,3.0,4.0,3.0,4.0,æ²’æœ‰,æ²’æœ‰,æ”¿åºœå‚µåˆ¸ã€‚å¹´åŒ–å›å ± 2-3%,4.0,3.0,4.0,3.0,3.0,4.0,4.0,3.0,"å°å¸«, è€å¸«, æ•™ç·´, åŠ©æ‰‹, å¹«æ‰‹, å¤¥ä¼´, æœ‹å‹",,3.0,å•å•é¡Œ,3.0,3.0,4.0,5.0,"ç†±å¸¶é›¨æ—, è‰åŸ, çŠç‘šç¤, æ²™æ¼ , æ¿•åœ°",4.0,3.0,åƒ¹æ ¼,3.0,4.0,"èµ°è·¯, æ©Ÿè»Š",0.0,æœ‰,4.0,"è²·æ±è¥¿å…ˆæŸ¥çœ‹å…¬å¸å·¥äººçš„å“¡å·¥ç¦åˆ©å¤šå¥½, è²·æ±è¥¿å…ˆäº†è§£æˆ‘åƒçš„å‹•ç‰©æ€§é£Ÿå“ï¼Œå‹•ç‰©çš„ç”Ÿæ´»ç’°å¢ƒ, å¦‚ä½•è®“æˆ‘æ”¯æŒçš„å…¬å¸æ›´ç’°ä¿",FALSE,FALSE,TRUE,FALSE,TRUE,FALSE,FALSE,FALSE,FALSE,FALSE,FALSE,TRUE,FALSE,FALSE,,æˆ‘ä¸æ‡‚AIå¦‚ä½•å¹«åŠ©æˆ‘,4.0,3.0,5.0,4.0,é—œæ³¨ç’°ä¿çš„è­°é¡Œ,,,,,,2ITG0,2024-12-25 - Taichung (NCHU) - 2ITG0.md,"--- START OF FILE 2024-12-25 - Taichung (NCHU) - 2ITG0.md ---

column3: English Translation
**Interviewer:** Basically, this is part of my thesis, an eco-friendly App. Do you agree to let me record your audio?
**Interviewee:** Agreed.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then, uh, have you used Momo before?
**Interviewee:** Uh, previously not much Momo, I use Shopee more often.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What types of things have you bought on Shopee?
**Interviewee:** Uh, I've bought food, for example, uh, cereal.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Is there anything you want to buy now?
**Interviewee:** I want to buy Bluetooth headphones now.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you help me search for it?
**Interviewee:** (Searches/Selects product)
**Interviewer:** Okay, I chose this one. Have you bought this brand recently? Sony?
**Interviewee:** I haven't bought it, but I know it seems quite famous.
**Interviewer:** Aren't there many headphones? Why choose this one?
**Interviewee:** Because it has a noise-canceling function, I mainly saw its noise canceling.
**Interviewer:** Then I clicked... then I looked at this. Okay. So, what did it (the App) tell you?
**Interviewee:** It told me, hey, it told me about the Sony company, and told me some information about Sony.
**Interviewer:** Right, company information. So for you, which part is more important?
**Interviewee:** Hey, it should be the country of production, yes, or its materials, just to see if there are any, uh, toxic ones, or some materials that are bad for the body.
**Interviewer:** Right. Okay. Then there are two buttons at the very bottom, so, do you, do you want to press one? Or it's okay if you don't want to?
**Interviewee:** It should be the alternative one. (Clicks 'Find Alternatives')
**Interviewer:** What does it roughly tell you here?
**Interviewee:** It told me, uh, Sony, Apple, Samsung, and Bose, these are various comparisons. Um, this should be more useful.
**Interviewer:** Um, practical. Do you have any questions you want to ask it yourself? (Points to 'Chat with AI' button)
**Interviewee:** Hey, can I... this one, let me see... Ah, it should be this one: Does the product I'm buying contain any harmful substances for me? (Clicks 'Chat with AI' & Types question)
**Interviewer:** Okay okay okay. I'll go online now... just click directly?
**Interviewer:** Um. Oh, okay. OK, this part isn't finished yet, because this is a Draft.
**Interviewee:** Oh, OK.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Are there any other questions you want to ask?
**Interviewee:** Uh, no.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you go back to the Momo page for me? Okay. At the very top, there is, also, also one, also two sections (green & purple tabs), help me take a look.
**Interviewee:** (Clicks green tab)
**Interviewer:** Okay. What do you think this is?

**Interviewee:** Uh, it should be saying that buying this thing can help you save more money and be environmentally friendly. Maybe it can save the earth, and see if it can be sustainable, sustainability.
**Interviewer:** What about these other brands, do you, do you know these brands? Have you heard of them?
**Interviewee:** These other ones, I don't seem to know. Haven't heard of the other brands.
**Interviewer:** OK. Do you think it will affect your decision? Like, or have you already decided what you want to buy?
**Interviewee:** Probably not, I should have already decided.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Okay. What about the third section? (Clicks purple tab)
**Interviewee:** What is this? The investment part. You can see, uh, see its stock price, um, and also see its stock prices in various countries.
**Interviewer:** Um. Have you bought stocks before?
**Interviewee:** Uh, seems like no.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Right. What is the content at the very bottom?
**Interviewee:** It analyzes Sony's stock price in the world, what the general trend is, the future trend.
**Interviewer:** Mhm. Okay. Um, okay. Then this is enough like this. OK. So there's a code at the very top. Um, that code just now maybe... okay, can you say it for me?
**Interviewee:** Okay. 2ITG0.
**Interviewer:** OK. Okay. Can you take a photo for me, what do you think is the most important part?
**Interviewee:** The most important part, I think it's this data section. (Takes photo)
**Interviewer:** OK. Okay. Could I trouble you to fill out this questionnaire again? Because I need, just that photo, like that.
**Interviewee:** OK OK. Thank you.

column3: English Translation
**Interviewer:** Basically, uh, this is part of my thesis, it's an, uh, eco-friendly App. Um, first I want to ask, do you agree to let me record this audio?
**Interviewee:** Uh, yes.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then, uh, have you used Momo before?
**Interviewee:** Um, yes.
**Interviewer:** Do you prefer Momo, Shopee, or other platforms?
**Interviewee:** Um, I use Shopee more often.
**Interviewer:** OK. What types of things have you bought online usually?
**Interviewee:** Um, I've used Momo to buy speakers.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Is there anything you want to buy right now?
**Interviewee:** Um, some movies...
**Interviewer:** Okay, do you want [to search on] Momo? Can you help me look it up? Momo...
**Interviewee:** Uh, Momo has... Momo probably has food. But I don't know if Momo has [movies]... Let me check what my Momo has...
**Interviewee:** Oh, it happened to pick that... What should I buy directly? Is anything okay?
**Interviewer:** Anything is fine.
**Interviewee:** Then I'll just click on shoes.
**Interviewer:** Do you have the Momo app on your phone?
**Interviewee:** Yes. Is this one okay too? No...åˆšå¥½ there's one, okay, I know. How do I exit this...
**Interviewer:** This is its (Momo's) advertisement.
**Interviewee:** Not what I want. Timberland.
**Interviewee:** No, then you just... okay, just search for Timberland. But...
**Interviewer:** Did the app have this just now? Yes. Look at this... oh, but it doesn't say ""boat shoes"". Oh, it's in English. Uh, it doesn't matter. Or I can just randomly click one.
**Interviewer:** Ah, but is this the one you like?
**Interviewee:** Yeah. Then let's look for this one, okay okay okay.
**Interviewee:** It's... oh, boat shoes.
**Interviewee:** I didn't know this Chinese word existed, boat shoes. Why isn't there... yes yes yes, this one. Okay.
**Interviewer:** Why did you choose this one just now?
**Interviewee:** Because I've been looking at this pair of shoes for a long time.

**Interviewee:** No.

**Interviewee:** It's just, um, other people wear them online too, and I think they look really good.
**Interviewer:** Okay. When you opened that, that webpage just now, did you see anything new?
**Interviewee:** Just some special offers on the initial page, Dyson.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Shoes. Okay, what about here? Here, oh this, what is this? Is this the one you just had?

column3: **Me:** Okay. Let me ask you, have you bought things (Note: JSON misheard as ""short-term"") on Momo before?
**Interviewee:** Recently uh... I accidentally, accidentally ordered, but I didn't use that one, and then canceled it later.
**Me:** Okay. What about other platforms?
**Interviewee:** Other platforms? Recently, uh, I bought one... I bought a flower made of building blocks.
**Me:** Okay. Is there anything you want to buy now?
**Interviewee:** Recently? Uh... What do I want to buy recently? Maybe I want to buy a pair of shoes.
**Me:** Anything is fine. Shoes. Okay. Help me search.
**Interviewee:** (Searching for shoes)... Some shoes...
**Me:** Uh... no? What did you want to buy just now?
**Interviewee:** I wanted to buy a pair, it's just that it has a... Hey no, I searched wrong. It's a pair of Adidas Hello Kitty shoes.
**Me:** Right. (Waiting for search results) It ran away... Can't find it? No. Not here? Are there other Hello Kitty shoes? Maybe they're already sold out.
**Interviewee:** Okay okay. Should I look for something else then?
**Me:** Hmm, okay.
**Interviewee:** Hmm... Oh, I want to buy this one.
**Me:** Okay. What brand is this?
**Interviewee:** Asics.
**Me:** So have you bought this before? This brand?
**Interviewee:** Yes, I've bought a pair, just the color is different, it was yellow.
**Me:** Okay. So Asics and this one, they have a collaboration?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Me:** Okay. You seem to know shoes quite well.
**Interviewee:** Uh, it's okay, just a little bit.
**Me:** Okay. Did you see anything new just now? Something you hadn't seen before?
**Interviewee:** You mean when I was searching for this? Hmm... uh... just, just later clicked in and there was this added. Then didn't see anything else new.
**Me:** Ah, you mean this software?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Me:** What is this software?

**Interviewee:** Let me see. Hmm... It's analyzing the product I want to buy, some of its introductions, and also environmental protection, environmental protection related. And also this... uh... What is this? This is... hmm, this should probably be something like stocks.
**Me:** Ah. Then for you, which part is the most important?
**Interviewee:** I think, uh, I think this introduction is more important.
**Me:** Ah. Then here, what's the main point inside this content?
**Interviewee:** Hmm... It's talking about probably, during the production of this pair of shoes, some of its materials or its environmental issues, the more serious pollution problems.
**Me:** Okay. What about your own view? Is there anything here that can be used?

**Interviewee:** Hmm... It has this ""Material Sustainability, Sustainability"", meaning it will tell you about this pair of shoes, uh, this material's, its sustainability, sustainability, so you'll understand better, like if you buy this pair of shoes, it can, it might not be good for the environment, like that.
**Me:** Hmm. Then at the very bottom there are two buttons (Note: TXT misheard as ""needles""). Can you press one for me? If you want to.
**Interviewee:** (Presses button)
**Me:** What is this then?
**Interviewee:** It's, it compares with some other brands, and then it tells you some other brands that, compared to this brand, are relatively more environmentally friendly.
**Me:** Have you bought these other brands?
**Interviewee:** Hey, no.
**Me:** Right. Do you have any questions you want to ask it here? Anything is fine, you can also type directly.
**Interviewee:** (Thinking) Then...
**Me:** This part isn't done well yet. Anything else? This one you just completed...
**Interviewee:** Product materials?
**Me:** Yes.
**Interviewee:** Ah, the first is this, the second is this, what's the second?
**Me:** Bought Leaders before? Hmm. Levi's? Hmm. Okay, these are all fake, because it doesn't know who you are.
**Interviewee:** Yeah.
**Me:** Doesn't matter. But I have bought Levi's before.
**Interviewee:** Hmm.
**Me:** But this can help you remember what you've bought before.
**Interviewee:** Hmm.
**Me:** Okay. Are there any other questions?
**Interviewee:** Probably no more.

column3: **Interviewer:** Okay. Uh, first help me open that momo. Have you used momo before?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Ah. What about other platforms for buying things? For example, Shopee?
**Interviewee:** Shopee, yes.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Besides Shopee, are there others? Or just Shopee?
**Interviewee:** Um, just Shopee.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What do you buy on Shopee? What kind of things?
**Interviewee:** Um... cat pet supplies.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Let's use momo this time. Is there anything you currently want to buy?
**Interviewee:** Um... okay, cat litter.
**Interviewer:** Yes, you can. Can I type anything?
**Interviewee:** You can type directly. Yes.
**Interviewer:** (Types) Okay.
**Interviewee:** (Browses)
**Interviewer:** Did you find it? Um. Cat litter... which one?
**Interviewee:** Here? Do you want to buy this type?
**Interviewer:** This one. Okay.
**Interviewer:** Which one is that?
**Interviewee:** Should I click?
**Interviewer:** Um.
**Interviewee:** Okay. (Clicks)
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you say what this is?
**Interviewee:** This is mixed cat litter.
**Interviewer:** Have you bought this brand before?
**Interviewee:** Um... no. It looks like the one I buy, but I haven't bought this one.
**Interviewer:** Okay. On this webpage, which part do you think is most important? For you.
**Interviewee:** Most important? Pictures.
**Interviewer:** Pictures. Why?
**Interviewee:** Because I can most directly see the product I want to buy.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Are there others?
**Interviewee:** Um... need to refer to it? Price.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What's the third thing you think is important?
**Interviewee:** Ingredients.
**Interviewer:** Ingredients, materials. Okay. What do the ingredients here say?
**Interviewee:** This ingre... ingredients are soybean residue, starch, bentonite, coffee grounds, mineral sand, etc.
**Interviewer:** Do you think this is okay?
**Interviewee:** Um... it's a bit different from what I usually use.
**Interviewer:** Oh? Why is it different?
**Interviewee:** Um... mine has simpler ingredients, this one adds many different things.
**Interviewer:** Ah. Can you look down a bit? Is there anything else interesting? Anything you're interested in?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Okay. That yellow part just now, do you think it's part of this webpage?
**Interviewee:** Doesn't look like it.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Why?
**Interviewee:** Because here it's white, this is yellow, and it has a special frame.
**Interviewer:** Okay. At the very top, can you take a look, there are three different sections?
**Interviewee:** (Looks)
**Interviewer:** Can you help me press the second one?
**Interviewee:** (Clicks)
**Interviewer:** What do you think this is?
**Interviewee:** Its materials and the relationship with environmental protection.
**Interviewer:** Ah. Have you bought the other brands? Have you heard of them?
**Interviewee:** No. Actually, I just got a cat, only two or three months ago.
**Interviewer:** Ah. Are you interested in these brands?
**Interviewee:** This one... because I don't understand... feels different.
**Interviewer:** Which one are you pointing out?
**Interviewee:** OK, should be EcoCat.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then the third section at the top?
**Interviewee:** Investment?
**Interviewer:** What do you think this is?
**Interviewee:** Oh, this is about the company of this product.
**Interviewer:** Um. What does it say?
**Interviewee:** It says it has a code, and the country and company name.
**Interviewer:** Would this affect your thoughts?
**Interviewee:** Maybe.
**Interviewer:** Why?
**Interviewee:** Because some people don't buy things from China, so some people, because this company has had bad incidents, it will affect whether they buy or not.
**Interviewer:** Oh, okay. So... OK. So this product is from China?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then... okay. Can you help me go back to the first section there? This one? Then at the very top, there's a number, can you help me write this number on the card?
**Interviewee:** Here? Just this number?
**Interviewer:** Can you help me say it out loud?
**Interviewee:** C-O-Z-N-2.
**Interviewer:** Okay. This is all anonymous, so this way I can know. Okay. Can you help me go down a bit? Okay. So below there are... there are two cases? Can you help me press the button? Yes.
**Interviewee:** (Clicks button) Then what else is here?
**Interviewer:** Um.
**Interviewee:** Ah... after I clicked in, it showed me my product, um, the brand, and then it gave me other recommended brands. Different ones.
**Interviewer:** Oh, have you seen these before? Have you seen them previously?
**Interviewee:** No. Just different ingredients, and different brands.
**Interviewer:** Do you have any other questions you want to ask it? This AI?
**Interviewee:** Um... can I click this?
**Interviewer:** You can click, or you can also directly type.
**Interviewee:** Ah... How do I reduce impulse buying? (Clicks button, scrolls)
**Interviewer:** You need to go up a bit? Oh, yes yes. Yes. Oh, got it.
**Interviewee:** (Scrolls up) Clicked twice. Um.
**Interviewer:** It will give you some suggestions.
**Interviewee:** Set a budget, make a list, think twice before acting.
**Interviewer:** What do you think is the main point in here?
**Interviewee:** Um... it answers my question specifically.
**Interviewer:** Um. And you're saying the main point of its answer?
**Interviewee:** Yes. Um... need to think clearly about what one really wants.
**Interviewer:** Okay. OK. Do you have any other questions?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then this is fine. Okay, thank you. Thank you. Okay?
**Interviewee:** (Nods)

**Interviewer:** I want to ask you now, is it okay to record?
**Interviewee:** Yes.

**Interviewer:** This... So I... I'm a master's student from the Professional Design Institute at National Cheng Kung University... design... uh... Then I want to ask... Can I record this conversation?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Have you downloaded the software before?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** Can you help me open momo?
**Interviewee:** (Opens momo)
**Interviewer:** Have you used momo before?
**Interviewee:** No. Is momo a shopping website?
**Interviewer:** Does the internet feel really slow?
**Interviewee:** Haven't opened the webpage. Oh, yes, I just used it today.
**Interviewer:** Do you buy things online?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** What platforms do you use?
**Interviewee:** Um... I use this one, and I also use PChome.
**Interviewer:** Ah, so you have used momo?
**Interviewee:** Yes, I've used momo.
**Interviewer:** What about Shopee?
**Interviewee:** Yes, I do.
**Interviewer:** Ah. So are there others?
**Interviewee:** Um... Watsons, POYA.
**Interviewer:** Ah, many.
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** OK. What about foreign ones? Foreign platforms?
**Interviewee:** Um... Have I used Coupang? Is it foreign? Coupang is Korean, right? Um.
**Interviewer:** Yes. Have you used Coupang?
**Interviewee:** Um.
**Interviewer:** Then on momo, what kind of things do you usually buy?
**Interviewee:** Uh... I buy everything. Uh... daily necessities or skincare products.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Is there anything you want to buy now?
**Interviewee:** Right now I want to buy... I want to buy sunscreen.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then search. You can.
**Interviewee:** (Searches) The internet is really... slow... slow.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you help me choose one? Choose one.
**Interviewee:** Yes. (Selects product)
**Interviewer:** Why choose this one?
**Interviewee:** Um... because I've used it before.
**Interviewer:** Um. Can you introduce what kind of product it is?
**Interviewee:** It's a sunscreen lotion, and it can just make your skin look nicer.
**Interviewer:** Um. Yes. So you've used the same brand before?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** Then you open this webpage, here, which part do you think is more important? Which part is more important?
**Interviewee:** I... probably... oh, it hasn't loaded yet... need to wait... yes. Usually, I would look at the price.
**Interviewer:** Look at the price. So why now... ah, is it saying it's loading slowly and hasn't opened? Or is there... is there internet here that can connect?
**Interviewee:** Yes yes yes.
**Interviewer:** The school's? Or can use...
**Interviewee:** Mine?
**Interviewer:** Can you use the school's?
**Interviewee:** I'm not sure.
**Interviewer:** Do you usually have this problem too?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** Material?
**Interviewee:** (Connects to hotspot)
**Interviewer:** Doesn't this waste a lot of time just waiting for the internet?
**Interviewee:** Yes. Now it... now the school's internet just disappeared.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Or I... can I connect my...
**Interviewee:** I can turn on mine.

column3: English Translation
**Interviewer:** First I want to ask you, can I record our conversation?
**Interviewee:** Record? Yes.

**Interviewer:** Okay. Basically, I'm a student from the Institute of Creative Design at Jian Gong University, and this is part of my thesis, that environmental app. Then later we will test this app, and after that, there's also a questionnaire. Okay. So the first question is, do you buy things online?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** What platforms do you basically use?
**Interviewee:** Shopee.
**Interviewer:** Shopee. Are there any others?
**Interviewee:** Taobao.
**Interviewer:** Taobao. Have you used momo?
**Interviewee:** Not yet for momo.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What type of things do you usually buy?
**Interviewee:** Clothes.
**Interviewer:** Clothes. So is this your first time trying momo?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Is there anything you'd like to buy?
**Interviewee:** Want to buy? Uh...
**Interviewer:** You can also just type directly.
**Interviewee:** Okay, then I'll type directly.
**Interviewee:** (Types)
**Interviewer:** What did you just type? What brand did you just search for?
**Interviewee:** Uh, Nike.
**Interviewer:** Uh, you need to say it out loud.
**Interviewee:** Uh, I want to buy Nike Dunks.
**Interviewer:** So have you bought Nike before?
**Interviewee:** Uh, yes, but not bought on momo.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Did you find the kind you were looking for?
**Interviewee:** Uh, yes.
**Interviewer:** Yes? Okay, may I ask...
**Interviewee:** Should I click into it?
**Interviewer:** You can. Okay. Why did you choose this one?
**Interviewee:** Uh, because it looks good.
**Interviewer:** Looks good. Right. On this webpage, what do you think is the most important part for you?
**Interviewee:** Uh... the product photos.
**Interviewer:** Photos. Also?
**Interviewee:** Price.
**Interviewer:** Price. What's the third?
**Interviewee:** Maybe looking at the size, whether my size is available.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Would you still consider other products? Or do you already know what you want to buy?
**Interviewee:** Uh... I might scroll down to see if there are similar products. Sometimes there are ones on the side, and then I might look... uh...

column3: **Interviewer:** Since this is your first time using momo, do you think the information here is sufficient? Are there other questions or things you want to know?
**Interviewee:** No. I think the information here, like having the size chart and price included, and also... I might look at the reviews again.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What about reviews? Are there reviews here?
**Interviewee:** Um, let me look. Are there reviews here? Yes.
**Interviewer:** What do the reviews say?
**Interviewee:** Reviews say the fit is smaller, need to buy a size up.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you help me go to the very top?
**Interviewee:** Okay.

**Interviewee:** This one? Um. Is this the environmental friendliness level of this product?
**Interviewer:** Okay. So, do you think there's anything important in here for you?
**Interviewee:** It seems Nike, this company, isn't very environmentally friendly, like that.
**Interviewer:** Can you click it?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What did you just click?
**Interviewee:** Savings. Um.
**Interviewer:** What is this?
**Interviewee:** Uh... uh... more, more environmentally friendly brands?
**Interviewer:** Have you bought these other brands?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Never seen them?
**Interviewee:** Haven't heard of them either.
**Interviewer:** No. Do you want to press the third one?
**Interviewee:** Can I press it?
**Interviewer:** Yes, you can.
**Interviewee:** (Clicks)
**Interviewer:** What do you think this is?
**Interviewee:** Stock price.
**Interviewer:** Have you invested before?
**Interviewee:** Haven't invested.
**Interviewer:** Seeing this, are you interested?
**Interviewee:** Interested.
**Interviewer:** What do you think that one just now was?
**Interviewee:** This current one? Um. Nike's stock price.
**Interviewer:** Then the content below, what does it tell you?
**Interviewee:** It says short-term, the short-term stock price has fallen, and also due to labor issues, it has received criticism.
**Interviewer:** Anything else?
**Interviewee:** If this brand continues to work hard, its evaluation will improve, and it will help the overall brand image.
**Interviewer:** Then these three... considering these three sections, which one are you more interested in?
**Interviewee:** Uh... interested in? Do you mean which part would affect my purchase of this product, which part would influence my reason for buying the product more?
**Interviewer:** Yes, yes, yes.

**Interviewee:** Uh... maybe the first one. Because investment might be related to this... this company's future stock price might not have much connection to me buying this product, so I might look at the first one about buying things. Because it very clearly pointed out that this product is not very environmentally friendly, and then... just maybe when I look at other products in the future, I will consider the environmental aspect more. Because normally when buying things, I don't really consider the environmental part. But if other brands don't look as good, I might still consider it, balance it out. Yes, because I probably haven't heard of them yet.
**Interviewer:** Um. Can you help me go down a bit? Then there are two buttons, do you want to press one?
**Interviewee:** Okay.
**Interviewer:** (Waits) Here you can still directly ask it questions. Do you have any questions you want to ask? Um, you can also type directly.
**Interviewee:** Oh... can you click this?
**Interviewer:** Yes, yes.
**Interviewee:** Button... let's go down.

**Interviewee:** Yes.

**Interviewer:** Yes.

**Interviewer:** No problem. Can you help me go back to the original place? The original place... um, the momo one. Oh, okay. Yes. Then there's the other button.
**Interviewee:** Okay. Let me see.
**Interviewer:** Is there internet? A little bit eh... is it not on?
**Interviewee:** (Checks connection)

**Interviewee:** (Connects) Connecting.

**Interviewee:** Not really. Got it. Uh...

**Interviewee:** It says Nike's Dunk shoe style mainly uses artificial leather and polyester fiber. These materials usually come from fossil products and have a greater impact on the environment. Then, the production process of these products often involves pollution emissions.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then help me go to that momo page.
**Interviewee:** Okay.

column3: English Translation
**Interviewer:** Okay. First, let me ask you, can I record our conversation?
**Interviewee:** Yes.

**Interviewer:** Okay. I'm a student from the Institute of Creative Design at Jian Gong University, and this is part of my thesis, uh, an environmental app. Then later we will test this app, and also later you can help me fill out the questionnaire. Okay. So the first question is, you... uh... do you buy things online?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** What platforms do you use?
**Interviewee:** Shopee.
**Interviewer:** Shopee. Are there any others?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Have you uh... used momo?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Then today is the first time using momo, is there anything you want to buy?
**Interviewee:** Let me think.
**Interviewer:** Anything... you can type directly, if there are any brands you like...
**Interviewee:** (Types)
**Interviewer:** What is it? Maybelline's... this one?
**Interviewee:** Maybelline. Okay. This lip glaze.
**Interviewer:** Why? Why this brand?
**Interviewee:** Because its reviews have always been quite good, and I've used their foundation, and also a lipstick, the color and texture were both quite good.
**Interviewer:** Ah. Have you used this specific product?
**Interviewee:** This one, no.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What product is this?
**Interviewee:** This is Maybelline SuperStay Vinyl Ink Liquid Lipstick.
**Interviewer:** Okay. On this webpage, where is the most important part?
**Interviewee:** Most important?
**Interviewer:** Yes. For you?
**Interviewee:** For me, the most important... uh... would probably be its shades? It should allow selecting shades.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What's the second?
**Interviewee:** Second would be the price. See if there are any recent discounts or things like that.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What's the third?
**Interviewee:** Third would be... let me see. Probably look at its reviews.
**Interviewer:** Um, okay, reviews. What are they saying?
**Interviewee:** Reviews... it says the color is suitable, comfortable on the lips without burden, and bought a second color, this color is suitable for light makeup.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Do you think this would influence your thoughts?
**Interviewee:** This... these reviews might make me reconsider a bit, because they didn't write very specifically.
**Interviewer:** Then at the top right, there's a yellow section, what do you think that is?
**Interviewee:** This is... oh, it helped me analyze its, its brand, and also some materials, environmental issues, etc., of this product.
**Interviewer:** Um. Is there anything you think is important?
**Interviewee:** You mean the three above? Or the content just now?
**Interviewer:** The content. Yes.
**Interviewee:** Oh... it's a brand with environmental controversies? I didn't know about this.
**Interviewer:** Feel... you mean do you feel this part is important? Huh? For you? Or is there anything you didn't know before?
**Interviewee:** What I didn't know before is, I didn't know it was actually a brand with environmental controversies. Then here, I might look at this part. If it's important to me... this one.
**Interviewer:** This one? This cause/reason?
**Interviewee:** Product packaging and raw material choices criticized for not meeting environmental standards.
**Interviewer:** Why is this important?

**Interviewee:** Just maybe... sorry... maybe for... like I want to buy this thing, and then later I might need to do some recycling, etc., and it also has some not-so-good impacts on the environment, that would affect whether I continue to buy things from this brand.
**Interviewer:** Um. Okay. Can you... look, can you help me look at the second section?
**Interviewee:** Okay.
**Interviewer:** What do you think this is?

**Interviewee:** This... this part is... wait... what? Okay... this part should be its chemical ingredients? Brand name. Okay. Then review... this section, its potential? Because many companies now focus on sustainability, and if they don't continue to make some environmentally friendly products, it might pollute the environment, and consumers might also boycott their products.
**Interviewer:** Um. Would you personally consider these other brands?
**Interviewee:** Other brands? If I saw these here in this test, I might go back and want to look them up, might consider these brands.
**Interviewer:** Have you seen these brands before?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Then if you... um... do you have any questions? Want to ask anything? About these brands?

**Interviewee:** These brands... um... I'd also want to see them... um... because I now know these have already reduced some pollution to the environment, so later I might want to continue looking at their lipstick brands, whether the shades released meet standards, and then I can look at its appearance to see if it meets my expectations, expectations for carrying it out. Um. And its price.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then the third section, let me take a look for you.
**Interviewee:** (Looks)
**Interviewer:** What is this?
**Interviewee:** Investment.
**Interviewer:** Have you invested before?
**Interviewee:** No, I haven't invested.
**Interviewer:** Then do you think if you had bought from this brand, would you want to invest in this company? If you feel this brand is a good brand?

**Interviewee:** Is it a good brand... If it's a good brand, only then would I be willing to invest in them. But based on what I just saw, they already have some issues with... uh... environmental topics, and if the public knows about these things, they might consider buying other brands, meaning reducing the choice of their brand. So I think I probably wouldn't invest in them much.
**Interviewer:** Um. Isn't investment for making money?

**Interviewee:** Isn't investment for making money? But... uh... if based on what I just saw, if they continue doing the same things, the stock price will fall, and I won't make money that way either.
**Interviewer:** Um. Okay. Then the first section, the very... bottom... uh, the first section... uh, sorry. At the very bottom there are buttons, do you want to press one?
**Interviewee:** Um. This one.
**Interviewer:** What do you want to press?
**Interviewee:** Uh... wait a moment. Find Alternative Products.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What does it say?

**Interviewee:** Uh... okay. It says below is a comparison table of Maybelline and other more sustainable cosmetics brands. Then besides Maybelline, it gives Shiseido, which has reduced packaging waste, animal testing, and actively promotes sustainable development plans. They also don't have animal testing, and packaging waste is lower, with more sustainable options. Then Revlon, reduced packaging waste testing, also no animal testing, and actively promotes sustainable development plans, no animal testing, and similarly to Shiseido, no... packaging waste is also lower... more sustainable options. Then this... Ilia? Probably also.
**Interviewer:** Do you think there's any important information here for you?
**Interviewee:** You mean these few? Like, you can choose, if you feel something is important, in which part?

**Interviewee:** I care quite a bit about this one, animal testing. Because I feel I quite like small animals, so for some... and I've seen some that use animals for testing experiments, I feel they are not very good. So I care a lot about this. I feel if there's animal testing, I try my best not to buy from them.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Do you have any questions you want to ask them? You can type directly, or you can also press these buttons.
**Interviewee:** Oh, these buttons?
**Interviewer:** Some buttons, but you can type directly if you have other questions.
**Interviewee:** Other questions... um...
**Interviewer:** Then this... you need to go up?
**Interviewee:** Say? Oh... sorry, it's okay, it's okay.
**Interviewer:** What did you just ask?

**Interviewee:** I asked if the product I bought contains any harmful chemical substances for my body. Um. Then it said, to understand if the product you purchased contains chemical substances, you can check the product's ingredient label or the product's digital product passport, which usually provides detailed ingredients and ESG data.
**Interviewer:** Um. Are there any questions it will ask you later?
**Interviewee:** Need to ask other questions?
**Interviewer:** No, didn't it just ask a question? I can help you check the digital product passport?
**Interviewee:** Um.
**Interviewer:** Do you want to?
**Interviewee:** Okay okay.
**Interviewer:** Then can you help me tell it OK?
**Interviewee:** OK. Okay.

**Interviewer:** Then this... this is all fake, it's not related to this product. But basically the idea is, if... if a product, that product could have a passport... this is basically fake. It... what kind of product... do you know about this? Do you know some products have passports?
**Interviewee:** Yes, I know about this thing.
**Interviewer:** Have you seen one?
**Interviewee:** I haven't seen one. I was looking for this before... someone was looking at this thing, but I haven't seen one.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then if just... if, if there was this passport, what kind of... what kind of content do you think the passport should have?
**Interviewee:** Passport... it first tells me its origin, ingredients, then... it... has some... wasn't it said...
**Interviewer:** Here? If you could choose, what kind of content would you want to see?

**Interviewee:** Origin, ingredients, then I also want to see that one just now about animal testing. Um... what else... let me think. Some have sustainability labels, I think whether it has a sustainability label could be marked. Um, probably just that.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then that's fine. Can you help me go back to the original place? At the very top, there's a code. This green code. Can you say it out loud for me?
**Interviewee:** Green... just this one? This code? Oh... B-P-D-S-A.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you help me write it on the card? Then what do you think is the most important part? Can you take one photo for me?
**Interviewee:** Most important? Um.
**Interviewer:** You can use your phone to take the photo.
**Interviewee:** Here? Why? Here? Eh... just now, I felt this... I was quite surprised by this, because I never knew Maybelline was this kind of brand, it shocked me.
**Interviewer:** Say it out loud briefly.

**Interviewee:** Uh... Maybelline has faced environmental controversies in the past, including packaging waste and animal testing issues. Then this matter surprised me quite a bit, because I always thought Maybelline didn't do this kind of thing, so I used to buy their products. But maybe after seeing this, I will reconsider buying their products.
**Interviewer:** Okay, thank you.

column3: English Translation
**Interviewer:** Let me ask you, can I record our conversation?
**Interviewee:** Um, yes you can.

**Interviewer:** Okay. Then I want to introduce myself, I'm a student from the Institute of Creative Design at Jian Gong University, and this is part of my thesis, an environmental app. So we'll be testing this app in a moment, and later you can help me fill out the questionnaire. Okay.
**Interviewer:** So the first question is, do you buy things online?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** What platforms do you use?
**Interviewee:** I use Shopee more often, it's more convenient.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Do you use the Shopee app or the website?
**Interviewee:** App.
**Interviewer:** Ah, have you also used other platforms?
**Interviewee:** Um, I've used momo.
**Interviewer:** What kind of things do you usually buy?
**Interviewee:** Usually clothes, or daily necessities.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What about on momo? Have you bought anything there?
**Interviewee:** On momo, I think it was a quick-cook pot.
**Interviewer:** Okay. So now let's open momo, can you help me find a product? Something you'd want to buy.
**Interviewee:** (Searches)
**Interviewer:** What were you just searching for?
**Interviewee:** An induction cooker, the kind for making hot pot.
**Interviewer:** Ah. For induction cookers, did you find the type you were looking for?
**Interviewee:** (Browses/Selects)
**Interviewer:** Are you familiar with induction cooker brands?
**Interviewee:** You mean this one?
**Interviewer:** Like, have you bought it before?
**Interviewee:** No, no, but I just wanted to buy and try it.
**Interviewer:** Then why did you choose this one just now?

**Interviewee:** Because it mentioned, like if I'm buying an induction cooker, I'll check if it's compatible with all pots, or if there are any other special requirements. After all, it's an electrical appliance.
**Interviewer:** Would you still consider others?
**Interviewee:** Another factor would be the price; its price is acceptable, not too expensive.
**Interviewer:** What are other important points? What do you think is the most important point on this webpage?
**Interviewee:** The most important point on this webpage? Um... Oh, the photos, the photos. Like, whether they attract me to click and look.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Is there anything else? That's important?

**Interviewee:** If I'm looking at the webpage, I'd probably place importance on how easy it is to use. Like, I can clearly see, for example, if I want to find this item now, I know where it is. For instance, it helps categorize things well, here are the electrical appliances, then I can click in and search, etc. It's more convenient for me to use.
**Interviewer:** Do you look at its reviews?
**Interviewee:** I'll still briefly look at the reviews, but for reviews, I might be more inclined to go online and directly see what people say...
**Interviewer:** Could you speak a bit louder, please?
**Interviewee:** Like, if it's about reviews, I'd probably lean towards, for example, opening another webpage directly to find if people say they've used this.
**Interviewer:** Why is that?
**Interviewee:** Because it's possible they bought this item on a different platform. And this way, I can see more comprehensive reviews.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Just now, there was a yellow section on the right side, what do you think that is?
**Interviewee:** Yellow? This one?
**Interviewer:** Yes.
**Interviewee:** Introducing the company, this product's... I probably wouldn't look closely at this, because I don't understand it anyway.
**Interviewer:** Oh, don't understand. Um, OK. Then, uh, take a look for me, do you think there's anything important inside it? For you?
**Interviewee:** What might be important is... like this.
**Interviewer:** What is this?
**Interviewee:** Plastics and chemical materials.
**Interviewer:** OK. Why is this important?

**Interviewee:** Feels like people nowadays care a lot about this aspect. Including things like plasticizers, or some... wasn't there something before... some suspended particles or something? I'm not clear. Anyway, it's related to the environment.
**Interviewer:** OK. So, what do you think is the main point of this content?
**Interviewee:** The main point is... the environmental impact of this product. Although it has received criticism, they have... they have already been improving.
**Interviewer:** Um. Are there others below?

**Interviewee:** Below it talks about materials, and origin, I guess. I think some people might look at the origin, because it's possible, aren't there people who feel that 'Made in China' means lower quality, etc.
**Interviewer:** Um. So, do you think these other things would influence your thoughts?
**Interviewee:** I might look at the item itself. Like just now, because I didn't see this earlier, if it's an electrical appliance, I might reconsider, because it feels a bit risky.
**Interviewer:** Oh, okay. Then there are other sections above, help me... click them please, can you see them?
**Interviewee:** This one? Yes.
**Interviewer:** What do you think this part is?
**Interviewee:** This is cool.
**Interviewer:** What is this?
**Interviewee:** Is this also talking about the environment? It seems like many people are focusing on carbon emissions now, including climate change and those things.
**Interviewer:** Oh. What does the part below say? No, the yellow one from earlier... what do you think these things are?

**Interviewee:** This one? No no, the one below just now. Oh, what are these? These green technologies? Oh oh... And the third layer is probably telling us about this product, things related to carbon emissions, and maybe because they're afraid we won't understand, there are explanations on the side.
**Interviewer:** Okay okay, no problem. Can you click the third section for me?
**Interviewee:** Okay.
**Interviewer:** What do you think this part is?
**Interviewee:** Stocks.
**Interviewer:** Have you invested before?
**Interviewee:** No. Recently I've started wanting to learn.
**Interviewer:** Oh. Seeing this, are you interested?
**Interviewee:** I would be interested in this.
**Interviewer:** What do you think of its content?

**Interviewee:** I think it's quite good. Because usually when buying stocks, you still look at the company, of course, the company's development. And here it has charts, and they are quite good, quite clear and easy to see. And there's a company introduction. Then there's the nature aspect here, because maybe the nature aspect, like when buying stocks in the future, the nature aspect might also be quite important, some industries that value environmental protection more might see their stock prices rise slowly, etc.
**Interviewer:** Are you currently considering buying any stocks?
**Interviewee:** No, because I haven't taken the class yet, I don't know, I don't dare to buy randomly.
**Interviewer:** If this software allowed you to buy stocks, would you use it?

**Interviewee:** I probably wouldn't specifically get this thing just to buy stocks. But if it was, for example, if I was a member of this website, and buying a membership gave access to this, then I would buy the membership, because while shopping, I could also look at this conveniently.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you help me go back to that first tab/section?
**Interviewee:** (Goes back)
**Interviewer:** Right. Then at the very bottom there are buttons... did it register the click?
**Interviewee:** This one?
**Interviewer:** Ah, take a look... you... ah, there are two buttons, which one are you more interested in?
**Interviewee:** (Clicks button)
**Interviewer:** Ah, you just... tell me, what button did you just press?
**Interviewee:** I just pressed ""Alternative Products"".
**Interviewer:** Okay. Why did you choose this button?

**Interviewee:** Because maybe when I first clicked on this product, I felt there could be better aspects. For example, the points I consider might be, suppose I came in because of its price, but then after entering, I found that its usage might be more complicated, or like the origin issue just mentioned. So I would want to see if there's something similar to it that can replace it.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you press that... um... right. So, um, do you have any questions you want to ask it? Seeing this... uh... do you have any questions you want to ask?

**Interviewee:** I would probably want to ask it, like, ask it to directly give me alternative products. Like it told me, it told me brands, but within the brands, there might still be many types of induction cookers. I would tell it my needs, and ask if it can help me find one.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you type that for me?
**Interviewee:** (Types) Done. Okay.
**Interviewer:** Do you think this content is important in any way?

**Interviewee:** Um... because like above just now, it... the point I cared about was maybe whether it's compatible with all pots, but it didn't mention that, so I specifically asked it. And then here it directly told me it has a design compatible with all pots, including its advantages. Then I might want to ask it about its disadvantages, etc., just to make my selection process more convenient and comprehensive.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you use your phone to take a photo of this part? And also, do you know where the most important part is within this?
**Interviewee:** In what aspect do you mean?
**Interviewer:** Like within everything, on the momo page earlier, or here? For you, where is the most important part?
**Interviewee:** I think this function [the chatbot/alternative finder] would probably be the most important for me right now.
**Interviewer:** Can you help me go back to the momo page?
**Interviewee:** (Goes back)
**Interviewer:** Then at the very top there's a code, up top, the green one. Can you say it out loud for me?
**Interviewee:** Click into it?
**Interviewer:** No no, just say it.
**Interviewee:** Uh, 2W7HO.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then can you help me tap on the card, write this code. The screen can... that's fine.
**Interviewee:** (Writes code)
**Interviewer:** Okay, thank you.
