column3: **Interviewee:** Buy clothes, cosmetics, and uh... (Note: Me asks to speak louder) ...books, buy books.
**Me:** Okay. Is there anything you want to buy right now?
**Interviewee:** I want to buy... I want to buy lipstick.
**Me:** Okay. Help me search for it.
**Interviewee:** (Searching) ...Yes, found it.
**Me:** Okay. Can you select a product for me?
**Interviewee:** I want to look at this one.
**Me:** Okay. Why did you choose this one?
**Interviewee:** Because this is one I've been thinking about buying recently... the color and appearance look good.
**Me:** Have you bought it before?
**Interviewee:** Not before, but I've always wanted to buy it.
**Me:** Okay. On this webpage, what is the most important part for you?
**Interviewee:** The most important is the price.
**Me:** Okay, product name and price.
**Interviewee:** The second most important...
**Me:** The second most important? Hmm.
**Interviewee:** Probably the pictures.
**Me:** Okay. And the third?
**Interviewee:** The third, let me see... its feature descriptions, these things.
**Me:** Okay. What about the price? Then reviews? Or others? Oh, the first important thing is the price. Right. What about reviews?

**Interviewee:** Reviews? Oh yes, reviews are also very important. OK. Oh right, sorry. Then it should be changed to the first... for me, the first important thing is price, hmm, then the second is pictures, and the third I would look at reviews.
**Me:** Okay. Just now, on the right side, there was a yellow (Note: TXT misheard as ""color changing"") section, what do you think that is?
**Interviewee:** Is this a chat window? What is this? Oh, you made this? It can help analyze... ESG-related things?
**Me:** What do you think is the main point here?

**Interviewee:** The main point here is... the point here is that it analyzes, uh, the environmental protection of this product... like an environmental index? Meaning whether they contribute to environmental protection, or if it harms the environment, like that.
**Me:** Okay. Would you worry about this?
**Interviewee:** Yes, I would, I would, I would care about this.
**Me:** Within this content, what is the most important part?
**Interviewee:** Probably this one... ""Although Dior (Note: TXT misheard as dial) has committed to using sustainable materials, its ESG rating remains low,"" like that.
**Me:** Why is this important?
**Interviewee:** Because, well, hmm, it has its good parts, right, and the not-so-good results, like that. Hmm.
**Me:** Okay. Can you open the second section for me? The second section, what do you think this is?
**Interviewee:** Hmm... This is, oh, it tells me, uh, if I don't buy it, it's like a feeling of protecting the environment to some extent, or what kind of impact it would have, like that.
**Me:** What are these below?
**Interviewee:** Those are brands that, compared to this one, are more important for environmental protection... more committed to environmental protection. Hmm.
**Me:** Have you bought these other brands before?
**Interviewee:** Yes, I have bought Aveda (Note: TXT misheard as avenda).
**Me:** OK. What do you think of it?
**Interviewee:** I think it's quite good, I think their products are good.
**Me:** Okay. Does seeing this influence your thoughts? Would you consider buying other brands?

**Interviewee:** Yes, I would consider buying other brands. But, uh... I feel there still needs to be... they need to have, how should I put it, similar characteristics? Like that. I feel, because I think the substitutability of cosmetics isn't necessarily that high. If I really care about this product, because like, actually like Dior lipstick, it's high-priced, right? When I choose to buy high-priced items today, it might represent (Note: TXT misheard) that behind it, there's something I want, for example: one, I want to hold, uh, because it's like I want to hold designer items, things like that; and two, this item is good enough that I'm willing to pay such a high price. So actually, for other brands, unless they meet these two needs and thoughts of mine, otherwise I probably wouldn't easily substitute.
**Me:** Okay. Then help me open the third section. Okay, what do you think this is?

**Interviewee:** This... ""You can buy past"" huh? Is this a code? What does this mean? Can track the company of the products you bought? Are these all from this brand? All from this brand. Right. Then why are the codes different? Oh, is the place of origin different?
**Me:** Two different countries. Yes, two different ones. You can invest in this brand. Hmm, yes. Have you invested before?
**Interviewee:** I haven't invested in these two brands before.
**Me:** Have you had contact with (Note: TXT misheard as ""metal"") investing? You mean stocks? Yes. You mean have you done investing before?
**Interviewee:** Yes, yes. But I haven't invested in this brand. Right.
**Me:** Have you invested in Taiwanese companies or foreign ones?
**Interviewee:** I've invested in both Taiwanese and foreign ones. OK. Hmm.
**Me:** So, do you think buying (Note: TXT misheard as ""selling"") things and investing in this company have any (relationship)? Or are they in completely different worlds?

**Interviewee:** Buying things and investing in this thing, I think there is (a relationship). I think the nature might be slightly different, but I feel buying things is also increasing, right? Increasing this... this company's funds and those things. It means you actually are... doing this action has a good benefit for the company.
**Me:** So if you really like a company's product, would you be more inclined to consider buying that company's stock?
**Interviewee:** I think I would, I think I would.
**Me:** Okay. Can you help me go back to the first section? The first section.
**Me:** At the very bottom, there are two buttons. Do you want to press one?
**Interviewee:** Okay, I'll press this one.
**Me:** What did you just press?
**Interviewee:** I pressed ""Find Alternative Products"".
**Me:** Why press this one?
**Interviewee:** Because I've already seen the not-so-good parts of this product, I would indeed want to see if there are other products that can substitute it.
**Me:** Okay (Note: TXT misheard as ""Huh""). Then, uh, what did it tell you?

**Interviewee:** It said, oh, it pointed out the environmental pollution issues of this Dior brand, and besides that, are there three companies? There are three companies that are actually more environmentally friendly, like that. Then it analyzed the ESG ratings of these companies, and some environment-related items.
**Me:** Do you think what it told you is useful?
**Interviewee:** This is... of course it's useful, I think this is useful, indeed this is true.
**Me:** Yes, I just thought of this question.

**Interviewee:** Yes, I would. And actually, although the information it tells me is useful, but these things, because I can't see its data, so I feel it's a bit like a subjective thought? Like that. For example, it directly tells me oh this is low (Note: TXT misheard as d), this is high, this is medium, then needs improvement, where it's not good, things like that, but it didn't show me the data.
**Me:** Okay. Do you have any questions you want to ask it? You can also type yourself, or you can press the buttons. You can ask it anything. You need to go up... up.
**Me:** What did you just ask?
**Interviewee:** I just asked it, ""How can I be more environmentally friendly?""
**Me:** Is there anything in this content that you didn't know before (Note: TXT used ""recently"")?
**Interviewee:** Before (Note: TXT used ""recently"") I didn't know... ""Consider buying then""... No, actually, I know all these things.
**Me:** OK. Can you explain what it told you? Okay. What do you think the main point is? Where do you think is important?
**Interviewee:** Uh, I think the important ones are that, ""Reduce shopping frequency,"" also ""Repair instead of discarding,"" and ""Support local products,"" these three.
**Me:** Okay. Do you have other questions you want to ask? Hmm, you can also type (Note: TXT misheard as ""answer times"") again to ask.
**Me:** What did you ask about this?
**Interviewee:** ""Hey, are there any chemical substances harmful to my body in the products I buy?""
**Interviewee:** Oh, then it told me I can tell it the specific product or brand, so do I need to type (next time)?
**Me:** Yes. Okay. (Sees interviewee typing) What are you writing? It's okay.
**Me:** So if typing isn't needed, would it be better to have a voice conversation with it?
**Interviewee:** Use voice? Okay... I think currently there isn't this setting. ... It would be a bit more convenient.
**Me:** Okay. You can also speak to it in English. Okay, if it's more convenient.

**Interviewee:** (Tries typing in English) Seems not quite right... Oh. Hmm... (Me: What are you looking for?) I'm looking for the... the English name of that brand... Never mind, I'll switch to another one.
**Me:** Is there anything in this (answer) that you didn't know?
**Interviewee:** Like, actually I didn't know there could be lead in lipstick, and I also didn't know about phthalates, this kind of more scientific chemical substance.
**Me:** Okay. You mentioned this just now, do you have any feelings about it? Does it influence your thoughts or anything?
**Interviewee:** Hmm, I'll realize maybe I shouldn't wear makeup so often. Yes.
**Me:** Okay. OK. Can you help me go back to the Momo page?
**Me:** Uh, at the very (Note: TXT misheard as ""table"") top, there's a code, the green one, can you say it out loud for me?
**Interviewee:** This code is 17LSR. (Note: Participant read E7L)
**Me:** Okay. Do you want to use the card from just now? I'll give you a new one. Okay, okay, okay.

**Me:** Okay. Why did you choose this cookie?
**Interviewee:** Because I really like eating this cookie.
**Me:** Okay. On this webpage, what do you think is the most important part?
**Interviewee:** Hmm... pictures.
**Me:** Anything else?
**Interviewee:** And the price, like that.
**Me:** Okay. What about the third?
**Interviewee:** Probably the reviews.
**Me:** Okay. On this page, is there anything you haven't seen before?
**Interviewee:** Hmm, there's this.
**Me:** Okay. What is this?
**Interviewee:** A more detailed introduction of this brand, and some information about the company that one might not usually know.
**Me:** What do you think is the most important point (Note: TXT misheard as ""place"") here?
**Interviewee:** Environmental issues and labor issues, and also ESG ratings, these things. Hmm.
**Me:** What is ESG?
**Interviewee:** Actually, I don't know.
**Me:** When you buy things, do you care about environmental protection?
**Interviewee:** Honestly, usually I don't pay much attention.
**Me:** Okay. Um, since there's quite a lot of content here, can you pick the most important point?
**Interviewee:** Probably this third point, there's a summary, it says the company's overall rating (Note: TXT misheard as ""status"") is 5 out of 10.
**Me:** Okay, ""Environment unclear, Social responsibility low,"" here. Okay. Can you help me (click) go up a bit, then there's the second section. What do you think this is?
**Interviewee:** ""Alternative Products"". (Note: TXT misheard as ""Above the airbag"")
**Me:** Can you speak a bit louder for me?
**Interviewee:** Alternative products.
**Me:** Okay. Have you bought these other products before?
**Interviewee:** Seems like no.
**Me:** Have you seen them?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Me:** Okay. Why are these recommended then?
**Interviewee:** Because the carbon emissions are lower.
**Me:** Okay. Does that influence your thoughts? Or do you still want to buy the original one?
**Interviewee:** I think if it's displayed beside the page, I would feel like I could switch to another brand.
**Me:** But wasn't the original one the tastiest?
**Interviewee:** Uh, I haven't tried it, but I can give it a try.
**Me:** Okay. Can you help me (click) go to the third section above? What do you think this is?
**Interviewee:** Invest in (Note: TXT misheard as ""Expired"") the product's company? I feel this part seems a bit unclear.
**Me:** What is this related to?
**Interviewee:** Like, I bought this product, and which company manufactured it, like that.
**Me:** Okay, this is related to investing. Have you invested before?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Me:** Never bought stocks?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Me:** Okay. Can you help me go back to the first section over there?
**Interviewee:** Okay.
**Me:** Okay. At the very bottom, there are two buttons. Can you press one for me?
**Interviewee:** ""Find Alternative Products"".
**Me:** Why did you choose this one?
**Interviewee:** Because I feel it can recommend more to me, like... maybe brands that are higher in environmental aspects or social responsibility.
**Me:** Okay. What did it tell you? Look at the top. Uh, ""Gouda"" brand and other more... (giving advice) No need to say it out loud, just take a look, do you think there's anything useful?
**Interviewee:** Oh, it means other brands might be a bit more environmentally friendly, so I can buy these brands as alternatives.
**Me:** Okay. Do you have any questions you want to ask it yourself?
**Interviewee:** Hmm...
**Me:** Do you want to type (Note: TXT misheard as ""answer"") to it? Can I press this?
**Interviewee:** Yes. ""Reduce impulsive buying"".
**Me:** Okay. Go up and press it. Oh.
**Me:** Up there, tell me what you asked.
**Interviewee:** I asked, ""How to reduce impulsive buying?"" Okay.
**Me:** Then it recommended I can create a shopping list, set a budget, or ""Think thrice before acting."" Is there anything here you hadn't thought of yourself before? Anything new?
**Interviewee:** I think, hmm... ""Choose sustainable products"" might be something I hadn't thought of before.
**Me:** Okay. Are there any other questions you want to ask?
**Interviewee:** This one, ""How can I influence companies to become more environmentally friendly?""
**Me:** What do you think is the main point of this content?

**Interviewee:** Hmm... I think the point... I think the point might be... still the most important thing is to take more proactive actions, like, say, you can directly give feedback to the company, or support relevant policies, like that.
**Me:** Okay. Can you help me go back to the Momo page? Then at the very (Note: TXT misheard as ""sleep"") top, there's a code, can you say it out loud for me?
**Interviewee:** ANGZQ.
**Me:** Okay. Do you have the card from just now?
**Interviewee:** Yes, I scanned it.
**Me:** Okay. Now you can help me write this code.

column3: English Translation
**Interviewer:** Okay. Let me ask you first, can I record this conversation?
**Interviewee:** Yes yes yes.

**Interviewer:** Okay. Let me introduce myself. I'm a student from the Institute of Creative Design at National Cheng Kung University, and this is part of my thesis, an environmental software. Can you help me test this software in a moment?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then the first question is you... do you usually buy things online?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** What platforms must you use? [What platforms do you usually use?]
**Interviewee:** Brands? Is Apple okay?
**Interviewer:** Anything is fine. Apple? Ah... Have you used others?
**Interviewee:** Are other things okay?
**Interviewer:** I mean the platform, the webpage. You don't need to come up...
**Interviewee:** Oh, Shopee.
**Interviewer:** Shopee. Okay. Besides Shopee, are there any others?
**Interviewee:** Taobao.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Have you used momo?
**Interviewee:** Not currently.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then then first... first time using it today. Okay. Is there any product you want to buy recently?
**Interviewee:** Want to buy a hair curler.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you help me find this product?
**Interviewee:** Is there Zhuyin input? Wait, I don't know how to use it.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What do you want to write?
**Interviewee:** Curling iron. Curling iron. Okay.
**Interviewer:** (Waits) Like this? Not yet? Second one? Second one? This one?
**Interviewee:** Yes yes yes.
**Interviewer:** Is there one here that you like? Do you have any particularly favorite... uh... products or brands?
**Interviewee:** These two feel pretty good.
**Interviewer:** Help me say it out loud briefly? Why these?
**Interviewee:** Because it can automatically curl hair.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Just need to press it?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** You just said there were two? Why the second one?
**Interviewee:** This one... because they are both... the two are automatic curlers. Okay. And because this one is a bit cheaper. Um.
**Interviewer:** Yes. Can you choose one for me? This one? Open it.
**Interviewee:** (Selects product)
**Interviewer:** Have you bought this brand recently?
**Interviewee:** No, but recently I've been considering buying it.
**Interviewer:** Oh, so you've seen this brand?
**Interviewee:** Um.
**Interviewer:** Okay. So, what are your thoughts about this brand?

**Interviewee:** The brand? Feels pretty good, because it can be listed [publicly traded], it should be good. And it has international voltage, um, which means you can... feels like you can take it abroad, and don't need a special adapter, so it's very convenient for girls.
**Interviewer:** That's quite thoughtful. Um. Okay. So here, on this webpage, where is the most important part?
**Interviewee:** Most important...
**Interviewer:** Here? Help me say it out loud, why here?
**Interviewee:** Because this way I can know how to use it. And because it also needs to be plugged in, having it written out like this makes me understand better how to use it more safely.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What's the second important part?
**Interviewee:** Here. Um.
**Interviewer:** What is this?
**Interviewee:** The first is the introduction of its brand, and the second writes its detailed product information.
**Interviewer:** Um. Then what's the main point within this information?
**Interviewee:** Um... manufacturing country is... and its material used is ceramic coating, PTC heating element.
**Interviewer:** Um. Would this information affect your thoughts?
**Interviewee:** Um... no... possibly yes.
**Interviewer:** Why?
**Interviewee:** Because the country is China, I'd be a little worried, still a bit worried about safety issues.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then the third important place on the webpage?
**Interviewee:** The third? Gone. Also... want more? If not, that's fine too. No.
**Interviewer:** No. Okay. Can you help me go up a bit? Ah, the second one? Can you help me open the second section?
**Interviewee:** This one? (Clicks)
**Interviewer:** Um. What is this?
**Interviewee:** What is this... its brand recommendation? Carbon emissions? Feels environmental.
**Interviewer:** Is it talking about environmental protection? Why?
**Interviewee:** Because of the greenhouse effect now, so carbon emissions are very important. Because it has reduced carbon emissions by 30%.
**Interviewer:** Then do... what about others? [Referring to other brands listed]
**Interviewee:** Should be other brand names? I'm not quite sure.
**Interviewer:** Have you seen these other brands?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Would you still consider other brands?
**Interviewee:** Maybe I would consider Dyson.
**Interviewer:** If you consider others, what kind of information would you want?
**Interviewee:** Um... information wanted... its manufacturing country, then how it's designed, then what material it's made of, how to use it more safely, whether there's a warranty.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Why are you so worried about safety?
**Interviewee:** Because after all, it will be close to the face, head, so if by any chance an explosion happens, it would be very dangerous.
**Interviewer:** Um. Okay. Help me look at one business section? Up a bit?
**Interviewee:** This one?
**Interviewer:** This one?
**Interviewee:** What does this mean?
**Interviewer:** Just telling me this brand, then consider... uh... reconsider their other products, like that? My interpretation is like that.
**Interviewee:** So... uh... does this have anything to do with investing?
**Interviewer:** You mean this is related to what? I didn't quite understand just now. Like with... like you can consider their other products?
**Interviewee:** Oh, consider their other products.
**Interviewer:** Yes. Okay. Uh... OK. Can you help me go back to that section there? The second section? The first... first one? The first one?
**Interviewee:** This one? (Goes back)
**Interviewer:** Down a bit, there are two more buttons. Do you want to press one?
**Interviewee:** (Clicks button)
**Interviewer:** This one? What did you just press? Help me say it out loud.
**Interviewee:** Find Alternative Products.
**Interviewer:** Why press this one?
**Interviewee:** Why press this one? Uh... maybe other brands are even better, or cheaper. Um. So one can consider, need to compare to know what suits oneself.
**Interviewer:** Then in the content it gave you just now, was there anything useful?
**Interviewee:** You mean here? Material usage, then environmental features. Because they perform better environmentally.
**Interviewer:** So what do these mean?
**Interviewee:** This is... this is Dyson, should be that Japanese brand. The remaining two I don't really know.
**Interviewer:** Then just now it told you the brands in English, here it's in Chinese, which one do you think is more convenient to understand?
**Interviewee:** Chinese.
**Interviewer:** Do you have other questions you want to ask it?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Then help me go back to that first section there? The momo page? Yes. Up a bit there's a green number. Can you help me say it out loud?
**Interviewee:** This one? APNOO.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you help me write this number on the card?
**Interviewee:** (Writes code)

column3: English Translation
**Interviewer:** I want to ask you, can I record part of the conversation?
**Interviewee:** Yes.

**Interviewer:** Yes. Okay. Let me briefly introduce myself. I'm a student from the Professional Design Institute at Zheng Guang University, and this is part of my thesis, an environmental app. Can you help me test this app in a moment?
**Interviewee:** Yes, yes.
**Interviewer:** Okay. So the first question is, do you usually buy things online?
**Interviewee:** Usually? Online, sometimes I do.
**Interviewer:** Then you would... what platforms do you use?
**Interviewee:** Shopee.
**Interviewer:** Are there other platforms?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Have you used momo?
**Interviewee:** Yes, just haven't bought anything.
**Interviewer:** Is there anything you want to buy recently?
**Interviewee:** Recently? Phone.
**Interviewer:** Can you help me find some products on momo?
**Interviewee:** (Searches)
**Interviewer:** Can you tell me briefly, what product are you looking for?
**Interviewee:** I'm searching for iPhone 13.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Why do you want to buy this product?
**Interviewee:** Because I want to change my phone, I'm looking at phones this time.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you choose one for me?
**Interviewee:** Choose one? Okay. Then just... (Selects product)
**Interviewer:** Why did you choose this one just now?
**Interviewee:** Um... it looks like it better fits the requirements I want.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Have you bought an Apple phone before?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What do you think is the most important part of this webpage?
**Interviewee:** The most important part... its pictures, the text and narrative...
**Interviewer:** Can you speak a bit louder for me?
**Interviewee:** The text description for its picture is very clear.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What's the second important part?
**Interviewee:** The second important part... um... is that its product content and the price section are written very clearly.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What's the third important one?
**Interviewee:** The third important one is its... its purchase options.
**Interviewer:** Okay. And the cooperation with these banks.
**Interviewee:** Okay.
**Interviewer:** Then, uh, was there anything new here just now? Anything you haven't seen before?
**Interviewee:** Um... on this webpage...
**Interviewer:** Is there anything new? A new section you haven't seen?
**Interviewee:** Something I haven't seen before? Probably this part.
**Interviewer:** Ah, this yellow section? What do you think this part is?
**Interviewee:** This is a... probably considered... comparative... evaluation? This is a simple comparison, allowing one to clearly see some of its background information.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What was that third section you pressed just now? The investment one?
**Interviewee:** Okay.
**Interviewer:** Have you invested before?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Are you interested in investing? Are you interested in investing?
**Interviewee:** Investing in this? Currently, it looks okay.
**Interviewer:** Do you think investing and buying things have any relationship? Or are they completely different things?
**Interviewee:** There should be some partial correlation.
**Interviewer:** Why?

**Interviewee:** It represents... this can show some of the company's operational status, especially the product itself, its... like the first one can show the background of this company, making one trust this product more. Then regarding its backend services, one can also feel more assured, for consumers.
**Interviewer:** If you like this product, would you be more inclined to invest in this company?
**Interviewee:** Eh, probably... probably yes.
**Interviewer:** Can you help me go back to that second section from just now? That... the second section?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** What is this?
**Interviewee:** It's... its title is Savings. Um.
**Interviewer:** Then these are...
**Interviewee:** It says... it tells me how much buying this product can reduce the impact on the environment, and how much nature it can save.
**Interviewer:** Okay. It seems there are these other things here, what are they?

**Interviewee:** It explains the recyclability level of its product, how its highlighted design can affect its lifespan, also including battery waste, its power supply design, and also including its privacy and environmental aspects.
**Interviewer:** Have you seen these brands before?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Do you care about environmental protection?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** Then if Apple phones weren't environmentally friendly, would you consider others? Or is it okay?
**Interviewee:** If Apple phones aren't environmentally friendly... I should probably research it a bit.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Help me go back to the first section? The first section? Yes. Then down a bit... um, where do you think the most important part is here?
**Interviewee:** The most important place is... Hutton...? Probably... Hutton? Okay, the ESG rating.
**Interviewer:** What does ESG mean?
**Interviewee:** E...
**Interviewer:** SG is that... that that sustainability and environmental protection evaluation standard.
**Interviewee:** Okay.
**Interviewer:** Then down a bit there are two buttons, do you want to press one?
**Interviewee:** Okay.
**Interviewer:** Press one.
**Interviewee:** (Clicks button)
**Interviewer:** Which one did you press?
**Interviewee:** Choose origin status.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What did it tell you?
**Interviewee:** It told me the origin of this product.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Do you think this is important?
**Interviewee:** Important.
**Interviewer:** Other than this? This is considered quite important.
**Interviewee:** Okay.
**Interviewer:** Do you have other questions you want to ask it? Type directly or you can press these buttons?
**Interviewee:** Both are okay? Then I'll press this one: Shopping, savings, and investment, what sustainable concepts are there? Okay.
**Interviewer:** What does it say?

**Interviewee:** It says savings, savings, investment, these things, regarding purchasing, one can buy sustainable brands and products to reduce environmental impact. Yes, enabling... social responsibility... supporting companies with social responsibility.
**Interviewer:** No need to think it out fully, just roughly say its... do you think there's anything useful, useful content?
**Interviewee:** It allows us to understand, when choosing... making purchase choices, which parts to pay attention to.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Do you yourself have any questions you want to ask?

**Interviewee:** 9J97Q.

**Interviewer:** Okay. Then that's fine. Okay. And on the card, there's also a QR code. This one? So I need to fill this out? And my swimsuit isn't great right now, I only have a swim cap. Yes yes yes. [Seems like off-topic chat at the end]

column3: English Translation
**Interviewer:** Let me ask first, uh, can I record this conversation?
**Interviewee:** Um, yes you can.

**Interviewer:** Okay. Then I want to introduce myself, I'm a student from the Institute of Creative Design at Cheng Kung University, and this is part of my thesis. Um, so we'll be testing this app in a moment, and later you can help me fill out the questionnaire. So the first question is, uh... do you usually buy things online?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** What platforms do you basically use?
**Interviewee:** Shopee.
**Interviewer:** Shopee, are there any others?
**Interviewee:** Um... only Shopee.
**Interviewer:** OK. Do you use the Shopee app or the website?
**Interviewee:** I use the app.
**Interviewer:** OK. Have you used Momo?
**Interviewee:** I've browsed it, but never bought anything.
**Interviewer:** Okay. So what do you usually buy? What kind of things?
**Interviewee:** Clothes, and cosmetics, things like that.
**Interviewer:** So now... if you were to test on this app, is there anything you'd want to buy? You can also just type to search.
**Interviewee:** I'd probably still buy beauty-related items, cosmetics, things like that.
**Interviewer:** Okay. So... are there any brands you like?
**Interviewee:** Um... no particular brand really, no special favorite.
**Interviewer:** Then what brand did you want to pick just now?
**Interviewee:** Um... this one, I guess.
**Interviewer:** This one? Can you say it for me?
**Interviewee:** Maybelline.
**Interviewer:** OK. Let's look at this one. Okay, found it?
**Interviewee:** Mhm.
**Interviewer:** Can you select a product for me?
**Interviewee:** (Selects product)
**Interviewer:** Why did you choose this product?
**Interviewee:** Because its reviews are quite good.
**Interviewer:** Have you tried it?
**Interviewee:** Yes.
**Interviewer:** On this webpage, what do you think is the most important part?
**Interviewee:** The most important part is probably the reviews.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What do the reviews say?
**Interviewee:** Just that they seem pretty good.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What's the second most important part?
**Interviewee:** (Silence)
**Interviewer:** The second one? Can you speak a bit louder for me?
**Interviewee:** Okay. Um, returns and exchanges.
**Interviewer:** Okay, why?
**Interviewee:** Because if it's not good to use, then I know how to return or exchange it.
**Interviewer:** What's the third most important part?
**Interviewee:** What's important is whether there's a discount.
**Interviewer:** Okay. What about the photos? The photos?
**Interviewee:** I rarely look specifically at the photos.
**Interviewer:** What about the price?
**Interviewee:** Ah, the price...
**Interviewer:** What's its price?
**Interviewee:** The price, um, here it's 399.
**Interviewer:** OK. Um, can you take a look at that yellow section for me, what do you think that is?
**Interviewee:** Its information.
**Interviewer:** Within this information, what's most important? What's its key point?
**Interviewee:** The key point... here?
**Interviewer:** Um, anything is fine, anything. For you?
**Interviewee:** Probably here? Where its information comes from? Things like that.
**Interviewer:** Is there anything you didn't know before?
**Interviewee:** Um...
**Interviewer:** Anything you didn't know before, that's new information for you?
**Interviewee:** Oh, it's from China? I only just found that out.
**Interviewer:** So does that affect you?
**Interviewee:** Not really. Um, I think it's fine.
**Interviewer:** Okay. There are two more sections at the very top, can you click them for me?
**Interviewee:** Um. (Clicks) This...
**Interviewer:** What is it?
**Interviewee:** (Clicks second part) What is this? What do you think this is?
**Interviewer:** Is this its packaging? Or what? What do you think?
**Interviewee:** Eco-friendly product? So does that mean its packaging is more environmentally friendly? Is that it?
**Interviewer:** Have you bought these brands listed above?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Have you heard of them?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Okay. There's still the third section above.
**Interviewee:** (Clicks)
**Interviewer:** What is this?
**Interviewee:** Invest in these brands.
**Interviewer:** Have you invested before?
**Interviewee:** I haven't invested in things.
**Interviewer:** Seeing this, are you interested?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Okay. At the very bottom, what do you think it's talking about?
**Interviewee:** The very bottom... stock price? Is it because of the raw materials it uses, so its stock price fluctuates?
**Interviewer:** You think? Um, okay, no problem. Can you help me go ""back"" to that first section?
**Interviewee:** Um. (Goes back)
**Interviewer:** Right. Then at the very bottom there are two buttons, do you want to press one now?
**Interviewee:** Um. (Clicks button)
**Interviewer:** What did you just press? This one? Can you say it out loud for me.
**Interviewee:** I pressed ""Find Alternative Products"".
**Interviewer:** Okay. What did it tell you just now?
**Interviewee:** It told me to be cautious about the chemical ingredients of this brand, and then it mentioned three brands, saying these are more natural and better to use.
**Interviewer:** Would you consider buying these then? Or do you think...
**Interviewee:** I'd probably want to go check out what these brands sell.
**Interviewer:** Why? Do you remember these brands?
**Interviewee:** I don't know them, but I can look them up.
**Interviewer:** Do you have any questions you want to ask it?
**Interviewee:** Ask it? Like... like which chemical ingredients specifically require caution?
**Interviewer:** You can type that for me.
**Interviewee:** (Types question) Like this?
**Interviewer:** Go up a bit. Seems you need to press that (send button)...
**Interviewee:** (Sends question)
**Interviewer:** Do you think what it just said was useful for you? How was its answer?
**Interviewee:** Well... it did tell me which part needs caution, but because I don't have related knowledge, it's really just something to look at.
**Interviewer:** Um. Are there any other questions you want to ask?
**Interviewee:** No.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Can you go back for me then.
**Interviewee:** (Goes back)
**Interviewer:** Right. And there's the second button, do you want to press it? Or it's okay if you don't want to.
**Interviewee:** Then no need.
**Interviewer:** Okay. Then, um, can you take a photo for me, of what you think is the most important part for you?
**Interviewee:** Take a photo?
**Interviewer:** Yes, use your phone to take a photo. Was it the first one I mentioned? Just, whatever content inside you feel is most important.
**Interviewee:** (Takes photo)
**Interviewer:** At the very top, there's a code.
**Interviewee:** Right.
**Interviewer:** Look at that green number, the code.
**Interviewee:** This one?
**Interviewer:** Can you say it out loud for me?
**Interviewee:** Um, 1S2SE.
**Interviewer:** Okay, can you help me write this code on this card. Anywhere... yes, here, here. Okay. The screen...?
**Interviewee:** (Writes code)
**Interviewer:** Okay, the screen. Okay okay, that's fine then.
